page.title: 15SHUSTOKE RESERVOIR
page.content: There are two reservoirs at Shustoke, a large "freshwater" pool fed from the River Tame (90 acres holding 422,000,000 gallons of water) and a smaller settling pool (8 acres) which is fed by the River Bourne. Both reservoirs are owned & administered by the Seven Trent Water Authority and supply drinking water to Nuneaton & part of Coventry. The large reservoir is used by the Shustoke Sailing Club for yachting. Both large & small reservoirs are leased by the Shustoke Flyfishers Ltd, who stock the water with Brown & Rainbow trout. The natural bottom of the reservoir produces an abundance of aquatic fly life providing a natural source of food. Shustoke trout are renowned for their deep pink coloured flesh & for their excellent culinary qualities.
